content:
Agenda:
- How was all hands?

Agenda:
- How was all hands?

I collected some links in my blog post
:wave:
both @nikomatsakis and i have been fairly overwhelmed with stuff, so the goal for this meeting is to chat and catch up after all hands afaik

hi all. I've been running around like a chicken with my head cut off after the all hands, indeed. The main thing on my mind is (a) trying to catch up on all the interesting stuff @RalfJ wrote about (I wasn't able to attend any of the meetings) and (b) trying to "connect" this group with the lang team in a better way

The lang team agreed, in principle, to establish a structure where the lang team meetings consist largely of "checking in" with working groups periodically, though we've not worked out the details. The idea would be that, at such a meeting, the working group attends, and we kind of discuss what's been going on
I'm kind of excited to get this going because I've noticd that there is definitely some "disconnect"
i.e., we've been having conversations, but lots of people (both in lang team and without) aren't really following -- which is to be expected! -- and are sometimes confused or surprised by the results
and/or imagine that we're talking about stuff we're actually not
so finding more effective ways to circulate summaries and get feedback seems pretty key
:wave:
i think that a really good checkpoint will be when we finish validity invariants
and can circulate the writeups we've done on this
I agree, though I think going forward we should expect to do more like "time-based" reports -- i.e., it doesn't have to be when we finish something (and maybe better if it's not)
but it seems like most imporant step is to start producing write-ups, whenever, however
actually @RalfJ I have a question

but it seems like most imporant step is to start producing write-ups, whenever, however

that's a really good takeaway
we talked about the idea of a "hybrid" validity invariant for references, where &T is not fully recursive but T must be bitstring valid
although I realize I am jumping right in the middle of this and that's bad, sorry
anyway I was just wondering if you felt like that worked at all, but I realize now I should ask that in a separate topic :P
/me crawls back to their hole
I think I posted this in the relevant GH issue
ok
but it's kind of weird
with &! being uninhabited but &&! not
(true)
I actually have to run, but will read backscroll
i'm moving next week from the uk to the us, so i'm actually also going to peace. try not to go too in the weeds--i'll be reading later! <3
well, not many people left then it seems^^
@Alan Jeffrey if you have any questions...
@RalfJ no I'm good.
Short meeting!
seems like it. ttyl!
sorry about missing the meeting, been quite busy with moving to munich while trying to turn in my phd thesis, i hope i will have more time soon
